content: Adjusted EBITDA improved over 80% to $25.4 million over the same period last year, driven by sales leverage on both costs of goods sold and labor. Adjusted restaurant level EBITDA totaled $46.9 million, an increase of over 37% compared to last year, sequentially from the third quarter to the fourth quarter of 2022. On an adjusted basis, fourth quarter net loss was $2.5 million or $0.05 per diluted share compared to an adjusted net loss of $7.5 million or $0.15 per diluted share in the prior year period. Part of its because weâre lapping, especially in January, we lapsed some big storms last year, but in February, even when we havenât lap storms, we think weâre going to, come out at the high end of mid single-digit on comp growth, in the first quarter. So, I think plus the reinvestment part of Reclaim the Flame, which weâre taking full advantage of, for our physical assets, thatâs important too, but I think the most exciting thing to me is the increased level of advertising that weâre going to see later in the year, which everyone knows about. So whether itâs them paying for the incremental marketing over the next couple years to them helping us with remodels on subsidies basis to theyâre not going to do something to drive traffic that reverses some of the progress theyâve made because if they do that, that could if for instance, they went back to â if they increased discounting that would obviously make it more challenging for us to or for the system to hit that 175,000 per store.
